resolution_description: As 'Scallops', propose the creation of a bio-inspired, AI-driven underwater monitoring and defense system that uses real-time data to adaptively manage fishing quotas and dynamically protect critical scallop habitats, ensuring sustainable populations and positioning the scallop community as leaders in marine conservation technology.

required_participants.reasoning: Recruiting the researchers is crucial as they will provide the necessary scientific expertise to develop the bio-inspired, AI-driven system and ensure that it is based on sound ecological and technological principles.

Involving the marine scallops themselves as a participant highlights the importance of their habitats and populations in the monitoring system, thereby ensuring that the project is centered around their conservation.

Engaging fishermen is essential to implement adaptive fishing quotas effectively, as their cooperation will be vital for the success of the monitoring system and to ensure sustainable fishing practices.
Colleagues-scientists can offer additional insights, peer validation, and collaborative expertise, which will enhance the credibility and effectiveness of the proposed monitoring and defense system.

resolution_description: As 'Translation', propose the development of an interdisciplinary global dialogue platform that facilitates real-time translation of scientific research, traditional ecological knowledge, and stakeholder perspectives into actionable insights, thereby empowering local communities to collaboratively implement adaptive management practices for sustainable scallop harvesting in the Gulf of Saint Brieuc.
new_actor: The name of the actor would be "Global Scallop Sustainability Translator (GSST)".
